gold.user: As a project manager, I want to retrieve all custom fields available in Jira so that I can understand what data can be captured.
gold.ideal: Returns a list of all custom fields with their details.

gold.user: As a product owner, I want to create a new custom field in Jira to capture specific requirements for my project.
gold.ideal: Creates a new custom field and returns the details of the created field.

gold.user: As a developer, I want to fetch custom fields in a paginated manner to efficiently handle large datasets.
gold.ideal: Returns a paginated list of custom fields.

gold.user: As an administrator, I want to view all trashed fields to decide if they should be restored or permanently deleted.
gold.ideal: Returns a paginated list of trashed custom fields.

gold.user: As a team lead, I want to update the configuration of an existing custom field to better suit our project needs.
gold.ideal: Updates the specified custom field and returns the updated field details.

gold.user: As a business analyst, I want to retrieve the contexts associated with a custom field to understand its usage across different projects.
gold.ideal: Returns the contexts associated with the specified custom field.

gold.user: As a project administrator, I want to delete a custom field that is no longer needed to keep our field list clean.
gold.ideal: Deletes the specified custom field and confirms the deletion.

gold.user: As an administrator, I want to restore a previously deleted custom field to recover important data.
gold.ideal: Restores the specified custom field and returns its details.

gold.user: As a project manager, I want to move a custom field to trash instead of deleting it permanently, in case we need it later.
